title: How to Make Crab Curry

steps.headline: How to dry roast the spices:Simply heat a heavy bottom non-stick pan and put the spice in it (without any oil).
steps.description: Reduce the heat to the minimum. Continuously stir with a wooden spoon, in order to maximize even roasting. After about 1-2 minutes, a nice aroma will come from the respective spice and the color will also change. Remove this on a plate and carry on roasting the other spices in a  similar manner.

steps.headline: Clean the crabs and put them in a saucepan with water (a little more than is required to cover them up).
steps.description: Add 1 Tsp of salt. Bring it to a boil and cook the crabs for 7-10 minutes. Remove the crabs, add 1 bay leaf in the water and reduce this water by half.

steps.headline: Meanwhile, take 4 dry red chilies, break them and remove as many seeds as you can and discard the seeds (we need the chilies to give a good color to the gravy yet not making it too hot).
steps.description: Soak the roasted poppy seeds and these chilies in half a cup of hot water (for 1/2 an hour).

steps.headline: Dry roast the other ingredients.
steps.description: Blend the onions, ginger-garlic, soaked chilies and poppy seeds, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, pepper corns and curry leaves, to a smooth paste.

steps.headline: In a pan heat the oil, add the fennel seeds and sauté for 10 seconds and add this paste.
steps.description: Cook on a low to medium heat until dry and light brown. Add the turmeric powder. sauté for 2-3 minutes more. Strain the reduced water from the crabs and slowly add to the onion paste, till the desired consistency is reached.

steps.headline: Bring it to a boil.
steps.description: Reduce the heat and add the coconut milk. Stir continuously, till the milk is blended well with the gravy. Add the tamarind paste. Sneak a taste and make adjustments if any. Bring it to a boil again and add the crabs. Turn off the heat.

steps.headline: Serve the crab curry with plain boiled rice.

text: How to dry roast the spices:Simply heat a heavy bottom non-stick pan and put the spice in it (without any oil). Reduce the heat to the minimum. Continuously stir with a wooden spoon, in order to maximize even roasting. After about 1-2 minutes, a nice aroma will come from the respective spice and the color will also change. Remove this on a plate and carry on roasting the other spices in a  similar manner. Clean the crabs and put them in a saucepan with water (a little more than is required to cover them up). Add 1 Tsp of salt. Bring it to a boil and cook the crabs for 7-10 minutes. Remove the crabs, add 1 bay leaf in the water and reduce this water by half. Meanwhile, take 4 dry red chilies, break them and remove as many seeds as you can and discard the seeds (we need the chilies to give a good color to the gravy yet not making it too hot). Soak the roasted poppy seeds and these chilies in half a cup of hot water (for 1/2 an hour). Dry roast the other ingredients. Blend the onions, ginger-garlic, soaked chilies and poppy seeds, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, pepper corns and curry leaves, to a smooth paste. In a pan heat the oil, add the fennel seeds and sauté for 10 seconds and add this paste. Cook on a low to medium heat until dry and light brown. Add the turmeric powder. sauté for 2-3 minutes more. Strain the reduced water from the crabs and slowly add to the onion paste, till the desired consistency is reached. Bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat and add the coconut milk. Stir continuously, till the milk is blended well with the gravy. Add the tamarind paste. Sneak a taste and make adjustments if any. Bring it to a boil again and add the crabs. Turn off the heat. Serve the crab curry with plain boiled rice.
